meanings.definition: Misallying: to form a bad or unsuitable alliance
meanings.sent1: She regretted misallying with that dishonest company.
meanings.sent2: The countries ended up misallying despite their differences.
meanings.sent3: The cat misallying with the mouse for a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The misallying of the two rival gangs led to chaos in the city.
meanings.sent5: Misallying with the wrong people can lead to trouble.

meanings.definition: Misallying: the act of forming a bad or unsuitable alliance
meanings.sent1: The misallying of the two nations caused tension in the region.
meanings.sent2: His misallying with unreliable partners always ended in disaster.
meanings.sent3: The misallying of the cat and dog made for a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The misallying of the stars in the sky created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The misallying of the puzzle pieces made it impossible to solve.
